snippet: Canada’s desire for closer ties with Beijing is causing an erosion of freedoms at home, immigrants say — particularly their right to speak openly....
abstract: Canadian Prime Min Justin Trudeau is set to visit China to build closer ties between two countries, which he says will boost Canadian prosperity and promote Canadian-style democracy in China; Chinese-Canadians, however, say China's growing reach is eroding their freedom to speak against Chinese government.

byline.contributor: Emily Feng and Carolyn Zhang contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Canada’s desire for closer ties with Beijing is causing an erosion of freedoms at home, immigrants say — particularly their right to speak openly.

headline.main: Chinese-Canadians Fear China’s Rising Clout Is Muzzling Them
headline.print_headline: Chinese in Canada Feel the Chill of Beijing’s Reach

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
